concept.title: Field Splitter
concept.shortdesc: The Field Splitter splits string data in a field based on a separator character and passes the separated data to new fields. Use the Field Splitter to split complex string values into individual components.

conbody.p: For example, if a field contains an error code and error message separated by a comma, you can use the comma to separate the error code and error message information into different fields.
When a field includes additional data and separator characters after the Field Splitter splits the data as requested, it includes the remaining data in the last split field.
If a field cannot be split as requested, the Field Splitter can pass the record split as much as possible, discard the record, write the record to error, or stop the pipeline.
You can include data from the original field in the record, or discard it.

section.title: Example
section.p: A Field Splitter uses a comma to split data into two fields and to discard records that cannot be split as requested. When it encounters a single comma, it passes the data before the comma to ErrorCode field and the data after the comma to the ErrorMessage field.

When the Field Splitter processes the following records:
GM-302,information that you might need ME-3042,message about this error,"additional information from the server" IMD-03234

The Field Splitter produces the following records:
ErrorCode GM-302 ME-3042
Message information that you might need message about this error,"additional information from the server"
The Field Splitter discards IMD-03234 because the record does not include enough data to be split.
